intro: Callista gouldii, commonly known as the Gould's callista, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and features opposite, elliptical leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy regions. The flowers bloom in spring and attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
